website_summaries.verdict: A cost-effective, lightweight tent suitable for novices and infrequent use.
pros: A bit less than 4 pounds, this tent is easy to carry, thanks in part to included aluminum alloy stakes
Adequate ventilation makes it a good choice for camping in warm weather
Affordable price includes a lifetime warranty
cons: Loose or uneven stitching is a common concern
Condensation tends to get trapped inside in rainy weather

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious hikers / backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and take down. Very light and nice pole design. Material is very thin, does not have a high quality feel. It looked cheap next to the REI Half Dome 2 I camped next to. Sewing of the tent was sloppy, unfinished edges and not very clean. See photos. Bag is too small and very hard to repack. Look for a better brand if this purchase is for serious backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Geo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy set up, plenty of room for 2 and light enough for backpacking. Fits just fine in a 45L backpack with room for sleeping bag and pad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the tent
customer_reviews.text: I love the tent! Got to try it out a few weeks ago, easy setup, seems durable, really like the double vestibule. It replaced an Apex 2 from Kelty. My only complaint would be the rain fly has a loose fit, no matter how the guy lines are set up. Might prove troublesome in windy conditions. Would also prefer velcro to tying the fly to the frame. Otherwise very nice value! Thanks, Excited to see your company grow
customer_reviews.author: John Vos

customer_reviews.title: First Use Notes:
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight Just enough space Roof pocket for wallets and keys Rain fly and tent were plenty warm on a 50 degree night No condensation Cons: Stakes bend easily (1 while driving into the ground, 1 was stepped on while in the ground) Magnetic stake topper meant to help drive stakes is useless and rarely stays in place NO DIRECTIONS - this was only an issue when it came to the end and we had extra stakes, 4 ropes and several unused loops on the rainfly.... no idea what those are all meant for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this tent until the fix the quality issue.
customer_reviews.text: don’t buy this. Had to return 2 for breaks and rips out of the box. Thank the lord I tried both before going backpacking for 12 days. I would like to add a disclaimer. Don’t let my rating of their tent deter you from buying their sleeping bags. Their bags are 6 star products. This tent would be worthy of 5 stars if they get control of quality. The design itself is fantastic but the quality is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A Gates

customer_reviews.title: Poles are heavy, stored tent is bulky
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong If I was a car camper I would go for this tent in a heartbeat but as a backpacker it is just too heavy and bulky for me. It is made very well and is roomy. There are pockets in all 4 interior corners and there is a loft provided as well as a footprint. You cannot beat that for the money but the single pole system which works well is heavy. I also worry about the close tolerances of the interlocking poles as any sand or dirt would impede them coming together. You just need to be careful with it. Great tent, but not for me on a long hike.
customer_reviews.author: majord04

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Elegant, priced right
customer_reviews.text: First tent I've used that did everything it was advertised to do. Easy to set up in light or dark. Great stitching, great placement of doors, perfect fly. I camping partner is my 85# dog that can sleep under the fly. So far haven't found faults, there must be, nothings perfect. This tent is compact, light, easy to set up/take down, easy to pack. The complete package is not the lightest, but the different ways to set up, fly only, net only, print only, allows me to pack what the trip dictates. When the whole package is needed, it is worth every ounce. I cannot say that about Agnes, Mountain Hardware, or Kelty.
customer_reviews.author: Kneelzsteex

customer_reviews.title: Great tent and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for my son who is a Boy Scout. I wanted a decent backpacking tent that wasn't overly expensive. Wanted a two person so my husband who is an ASM could share the tent when they go on scout outings together. This is an awesome tent. Very roomy inside for two people and their gear. It also is super easy to set up for my son on his own and high quality material. Love all the little pockets for keeping flashlights, etc also. The waterproof rain cover is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Defective Zipper
customer_reviews.text: I just received this tent and set it up in my house to test it out. Things I like- good size for two people. The one tent pole was easy to set up once I figured it out. I was unable to find set up instructions and had to refer to the pictures on amazon to help me with set up. I also like the color and style. Things I don’t like- zipper was jammed already and I was unable to fix it. I think I just received one with a defective zipper. It is also a little heavier than I expected. Overall, I will probably return and try a new one since the zipper is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie E.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: I’m 330 lbs 6’ and for me this is a 1.5 man tent or me and my gear, period. Like: this is one of the best things I’ve ever purchased. Small, lightweight, EASY to put up in 5 mins. Love the two doors. Just used this, cold, 8 degrees, but I had a great sleeping bag. The tent did well in the cold. It’s very small, but it’s extremely compact in the back pack. And very light. Good construction.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE H.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent to have!
customer_reviews.text: This product is made with strong & great quality materials. The tent structure a little heavier than expected, but more less expensive than other tents of the same quality or less! Satisfying to use, this hikers tent fits 2 people just fine with plenty of space. I give it 4 stars because one of the rain fly’s vestibule zipper split away because I set the rain flies corners too tight and had the zipper undone while setting it up, but I expected the zipper to be able to be able to stay together like suite case. I advise anyone who buys it, don’t make the same mistake I did & you’ll really be pleased with the this surprisingly quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Received the other day and was excited enough to set it up in my living room just to make sure everything was as it should be. Overall quality seems below expectation. A few of the seams that were supposed to be sewn together and taped, weren't completely sewn and portions were only held together with the seam tape. Wondering about overall durability and how long that will last. The footprint was a nice addition, however, one of the tabs that hold the poles on the four corners didn't have the little metal eyelet, just a hole in the material. After all the good reviews on this company and this particular product, really wondering about their quality control.
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This tent is impressive, esp at this price. Love the room inside. I'll use it solitary but there really is room for 2. It is not as light as I would like but being 6' tall I have sacrificed weight to not feel claustrophobic or get my sleeping bag footbox wet from being against the tent wall. This is not an ultralight but it has a useful ultralight option by not using the inside netting/bathtub floor, instead using the rain fly as a tarp and sleeping on the very nice included footprint. They include everything you'll need. Did great during two week trip with lots of rain - no leaks!
customer_reviews.author: tinseltown

customer_reviews.title: More pros than cons
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t camped with it, but I did set it up, it’s not too heavy nor is it lightweight if you’re s backpacker. - I love the double doors so no one has to crawl over each other. - I love the color choices - I like the easy assembly - I love that I can sit up straight in the tent - I love the pockets in each corner to hold items - I love the footprint that comes with it
customer_reviews.author: Seth Harris

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: This tent makes me say "Hubba, Hubba" except it is 1/3 the price and comes with a ground sheet. There are a few other brands out there this exact style, maybe $10 less but they are short in the main dimensions 3-5" compared to the Hike and Bike. So happy after the first outing and it got down to 20 degrees overnight. There is certainly room for two people, each with their own door and dry vestibule to store their pack. With just one person then there is all kind of room inside for gear. Great poles, highest quality. Everything else seems put together correctly and the design can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hersman

customer_reviews.title: Fast Pitch, Roomy, Holds-Up, Looking Towards Years of Use
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Easy setup as advertised (without guide or prior experience, I pitch the tent first in my living room under 15 minutes). Note: Don't be afraid to secure and then bend the poles! More than enough room for myself and one other on a hiking trip. We could have squeezed in a third, so spacious is the tent. The rain cover and footprint served very well on the trip as it survived a thunderstorm. After getting the tent cleaned up, I hope to take it out on many more adventures. (That, and the feeling of being able to live anywhere is very comforting.)
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy C

customer_reviews.title: Loose threads hanging everywhere
customer_reviews.text: It's a ok tent but I don't think it will last very long. Lots of loose threads expecially around the zippers and it has some of the mesh screen sewn into the zipper too. Seems cheaply made. Go to Wal-Mart and get a $30 tent
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit large for backpacking but given the room and accessories I guess that’s to be expected. We used it on overnight (“test run”) and it went up very easy and afforded plenty of space for us and our gear. It rained during the night but everything remained dry. I was able to pack up tent while leaving fly up to keep it dry and 99% of the water shook right off the fly . We’re very happy with this tent and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great USA made tent!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my tent. I compared the specs and reviews of over 20 backpacking tents before settling on this. Mine arrived quickly with none of the previously mentioned manufacturing issues. Great tent, easy setup, and very roomy for 2 people. We had it out in extremely buggy country and it did it's job. I really like the 4 pockets and gear loft. My only real feedback to the manufacturer is that I wish it came with a smaller bag for the tent itself. I ended up ditching the larger bag and transporting the tent by itself in my backpack. I also used it without to footprint to shave weight since the bottom is rated at 63D.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love size and comfort
customer_reviews.text: We love the size and comfort. My son, a LifeScout, says he won’t use any other brand. He used it while backpacking through Ireland and worked great (Plenty of room for one 6foot teenage boy and gear). Worth the price for the moderate camper.
customer_reviews.author: Shannan

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for the perfect tent Hyke & Byke!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this tent! It stores away easily and has everything you need: including a footprint. The tent size is definitely geared towards one person with room for gear: I personally would not be comfortable with two people in it. The pockets on the side and top are great for small item storage. The rain flap has held up to multiple windy storms. I tend to leave everything open to get a cool breeze, which it does an amazing job of.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm am writing this while currently in the tent during a thunderstorm with 40+ mile an hour wind. The tent is performing fantastic. I bought this for my trip to Sturgis this year. Works great for a good tent that you can load on a motorcycle that won't take up too much space. The whole package may be a little heavy for backpacking but works great what I needed it for. Excellent pack tent for motorcycle trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: My best purchase of the year. Better quality than expected. Light weight. Lots of features. I used this tent while riding RAGBRAI 2018 in July. It might have been my best purchase for the trip. The tent was very easy to set up and one person can do it within minutes. We had one serious thunderstorm and the tent held up great. It stayed fixed during the high winds and heavy rain. No leaks. Packs up nicely and is lightweight. The orange fly was easy to spot in the crowded campground. Safety aside, if I was to buy another one I would go with a forest green fly as the color fits in better with the landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: very good tent
customer_reviews.text: was in 30 mph winds on the cliffs of northern califonia this tent didn't budge dew didn't get threw the tent in the morning time fits in my tail box on my motorcycle very easy havn't got to try in the desert yet for star gazing but sure it will be just fine
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for 1 person
customer_reviews.text: The one pole set up makes this tent a very easy set up for a single person. I prefer hammock camping but needed a tent that was light weight and easy to set up when no trees are available and this definitely fit the bill. When my son saw it set up, he decided he needed one too. I did have some issues with ordering through Amazon because they sent me the wrong product twice (the Yosemite tent [2 individual poles] instead of the Zion). So I ended up sending both of those back and ended up ordering directly from the Hyke & Byke website to receive the correct product. Their customer service was great and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Have set up a few times at home, but have yet to take it out on a camping trip. Set up was incredibly easy and only took a few minutes. Tent is very sturdy and I am amazed at the amount of room on the inside. I can't wait to take this on my next White Mountains trip!!
customer_reviews.author: Roland Thomas Brassard

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome buy! So easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy we purchased this tent for backpacking. It's so easy to assemble and is very lightweight. It was very comfortable to sleep in, while we chose to sleep without the wind hat, we did install it at first but decided the weather was nice enough for us to sleep under the stars with just the netted portion of the tent. It was wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Creig

customer_reviews.title: Good Backpacker at a super low price
customer_reviews.text: Super low price point for a backpacking tent with these features. Setup and take down is pretty easy. Mine didn't come with the advertised puck for pushing tent stakes down :( but the stakes aren't particularly difficult to work with. I simply used the stakes to push the other stakes down. The inner stitching on the zipper on one side of the tent was pretty sketchy looking but has held up through a couple of camping trips so far. I'm looking forward to using this tent a lot more in 2019 and I'll update this review after 10 or so more trips to touch on long term ownership.
customer_reviews.author: OctopusKyle 🐙

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent so much!! It’s super cute and really easy to set up. I took it on a camping trip recently and it for me and my stuff just perfectly. There is room for a second person but I didn’t have a second person this time. I love all the details of the tent. I love that you have the option to sleep completely exposed with the entire tent being mesh but then also have the option to put on the fly tent. The double doors and the ventilation pockets make this tent even better!! I highly recommend. I was not disappointed at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Every piece is made with great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this camping yet, but I did set everything up already. This is a quality tent. From the stakes to the stitching. I am really impressed so far. I am going in mid August. If there are no updates after my camping trip then I have no issues. I have owned quite a few tents and none of them had every aspect covered like this one. One might have a great frame but sub par ropes or stakes. Or the material was not great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Used this in AZ on a backpack hunting trip. Worked great for two guys. The wind was blowing 20+ all night. The only complaint I have is not the tents fault. The area we were in has very fine dirt so it blew right under the fly and all over everything. I may have been able to tie the fly down a little lower and maybe that would have helped. The tent held up very well and despite the dirt making it through I will be using it again. Keep in mind the sides are mesh to save on weight so wind will get through no matter what. Just get the fly as low as it will go.
customer_reviews.author: R Reed

customer_reviews.title: Love my new tent
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my new Zion 2P tent. First use was guiding a group of high school students on a weekend hiking trip. It poured with rain in the mountains on the Saturday night but I stayed nice and dry. I'm a big guy too (6'2"), and I appreciated the room to move around and spread out my gear inside. I'm happy with the quality too. Stitching, zippers, fabric, poles, all look well made and durable. Maybe not the lightest or most compact 2 person backpacking tent on the market, but I'd say great quality for the price. I will be recommending to others and buying more Hyke'n'Byke products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: I'd totally recommend this to others
customer_reviews.text: I'm not normally a tent camper. I'm normally a hammock and tarp camper but was going on a trip where they don't allow hammocks. As a result I bought this one and was extremely impressed. I'm 6'1" and had more than enough room for myself and I parked my gear and boots under one of the two vestibules. And even in severe rain and wind myself and my gear all stayed dry. I would definitely recommend this for others.
customer_reviews.author: Poppa Jos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: Own 2 of these for backpacking in the mountains with my family. They are light enough for the price. Waterproof without spraying it. It is really well designed and nice for the price. We do Colorado bike in camping in the mountains. It sleeps 2 and a dog. Or 2 and a small kid. Have done both ways.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tent. Compact, so easy to setup. It rained all night on my first time using it and i stayed completely dry.. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in weather!
customer_reviews.text: It took me 2 years to commit to this purchase. Frankly, I wish I hadn't waited so long! I have tested this tent in all types of weather with the exception of snow. We can sleep comfortably without worry. My husband's head nor feet touch the walls (he stands at 6.3) I pack this in my kayak for long trips and it will continue to be the tent I recommend as long as they continue to sell them!
customer_reviews.author: Houston Hill

customer_reviews.title: best for room and weight.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this now several times, both in a forest environment as well as a rocky desert scrub environment. Not the lightest out there but for the room and comfort, best compromise I have seen. Now my favorite tent even when I am "Car Camping" and not concerned with weight. For my bike camping , nothing better.
customer_reviews.author: El Capitan de Nube Escondido

customer_reviews.title: Large tent for 2 persons
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, did a set up at home but have not used yet.i got the 2 person and it is huge I think I could have gotten the 1 person and maybe had enough room for 2 because in the 2 person theirs enough room for 3.i would like to see the 1 person but as always another great product from Hyke and Byke.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Ultra light & super easy to pitch
customer_reviews.text: Tent arrived within 1 day and came in a very small, lIghtweight box... pulled out the tent bag & slapped it together in less than 3 minutes (didn’t even use the directions)! Super simple design, extremely light weight, and veryyyyyy roomy inside! Looking forward to breaking it on the trail this month! So far, def recommend the 2 Person/ 3 season Zion!!
customer_reviews.author: S.Kenned

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light, but shoddy sewing!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly compact and light weight at around 2kg. Pole folds up quite short which is good. However, the manufacturing quality is a bit shoddy with some rather amateur-looking sewing in places. Think I could have done better on my grandmother's old treadle Singer!
customer_reviews.author: Timbini

customer_reviews.title: Great packaging, great value and great company mission
customer_reviews.text: I’ve yet to take this backpacking, but tested the set up. It’s really easy to set up with one person and has a very smart design. I’m sure there’s lighter, but it’s light enough to carry alone or splitting the load with a fellow backpacker — even a 12 year old one. I’m 4 of 5 on lightweight and durability, simply because I’ve yet to take it out yet. Will update if needed. If you’re looking for a great tent without the second mortgage, then definitely give it a serious look. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up - value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very easy to set up and can be done quickly. The rain cover could be slightly bigger to reach the ground. The vents at the top need a stiffer brace to keep open. They easily bend and won’t hold the vent open. Had my doubts about the single pole design but assuming it last - love it. Foot print is nice add on - be even nicer if it covered the vestibule area Excellent overall tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 28 mile backpacking trip to Enchanted Valley. It was perfect. Easy set up and love the 1 pole design and little tool for pushing in the stakes. It has cool reflectors at night too. Also, you can set up just the footprint and rainfly first if it's raining and then go inside and set up the tent so it doesn't get wet. Same in reverse too. Take down tent and then rainfly and footprint. Super handy. Lots of room and pockets. The vestibules really add space as well for shoes, packs and even cooking. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sada Doup

customer_reviews.title: This is a very strong tent
customer_reviews.text: The first tent we received had a minor manufacturing fault. We needed the tent for an planed event with no time to return it. On calling Hyke & Byke we were told to return the tent after our event. As it turned out we had to erect the tent in a very limited space on very rocky ground. Our main need for the tent was protection from sun on a California Mountain top. The tent stood up to these difficult conditions extremely well. I have been very impressed by the tent and the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quite durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup quickly. Kept me comfortable and dry in a driving rain with wind gusts up to 50 mph. My tent stood it out while others became sails or piles of wet fabric. Enough room for me to sleep and move easily and still keep my extra large pack inside.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B

customer_reviews.title: great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent for my 11 yr Boy Scout son. Quick easy set up, light weight configuration for true back packing trips, heavier bug proof configuration for typical Florida weekend trips. love the fact that it comes with a foot print to protect the tent floor, most backpacking tents do not, easily adding another $50 to cost.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this tent for my recent trip to Grand Teton national Park. It was extremely easy to set up and very durable. I had no trouble at all. I'm very glad I bought this tent over all the others I was looking at.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Used the tent as well as the sets of sleeping bags we have from this company over Memorial Day weekend in the Sangre de Cristo mountain range in Colorado, the nights got down to the low 30s with a lot of wind, and everything worked perfectly. Looking forward to taking these out to for some back country backpacking soon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to set up and comes with everything needed. I honestly haven’t used it much but it’s compact enough to not take up much space and that alone is a huge plus. It easily sets up in less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: BrentTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Great tent and not just for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent about a year ago, used a few times in the fall. Really like this tent so far, easy set up, with plenty of room inside if used as a one person tent(bigger guy). The double vestibules are very nice for keeping gear outside of the tent, while remaining covered by the rain fly. Overall, I'd buy another one if I needed another tent. Also recommend the hyke and byke synthetic down sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rich James

customer_reviews.title: Great and lightweight tent.
customer_reviews.text: I’m digging this tent! I’m not an expert with backpacking gear but I would guess experts would appreciate the features. It’s a breeze to set up, the poles simply pop in place. For our first trip, we wanted to sleep with the raincover off, which we did - until it started to rain. We had the rain cover handy, just in case, and loved that it only took 4 clips to secure it in place. So easy! It’s lightweight and easy to carry. Oh, it’s roomy for 2 people and your gear! I did find it odd that instructions weren’t included but emailed a day or two after delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level tent for people new to backpacking. My wife & I have used it on 2 3 days hikes & it has been perfect. We are both 5’5” and it is good for us. If much taller or wider, may not be too comfortable. With the dual vestibules it is nice to cook in bad weather and perfect to keep boots outside. Worth every penny and I intend to buy another to keep in my bug out vehicle fir SHTF times
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent, very roomy very easy to put up. The only thing is beware that the stakes are very sharp on the backside. The treble hooks on bottom are very very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: tomas perez

customer_reviews.title: good tent. My only negative is the design of ...
customer_reviews.text: good tent. My only negative is the design of tent stake and it's round tool. It's very easy to lose it and i got one tent stake bent.
customer_reviews.author: Wenbin Zhao

customer_reviews.title: High quility tent and material
customer_reviews.text: This tents material is high quality the 1 piece pole is awesome. The tent comes with no set up instructions but this thing is so easy to set up if you need instructions you shouldn't be leaving your living room. The high vis rainfly, reflective guidelines tent stakes and foot print just adds to the quality of this tent at a low price, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for bike packing with the kids
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Quick and easy to set up. Perfect for camping with my 2 kids. Stayed dry with no condensation even in Winter with low temperatures. Fortunately stayed warm too! I was even able to use some soap less washing products to freshen up inside the tent whilst it was around 1 degree Celsius and blowing a gale outside. Impressed with the quality and the single pole system and the pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Swish Cycles

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $
customer_reviews.text: Very nice compact well put together tent. I'm using it as a motorcycle camping tent, plenty of room for me and my gear. My only complaint is the vent supports are not very good, the vent's do not stay completely open.
customer_reviews.author: Erik from VA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent has served us very well while BLM camping in Utah. Very easy to put up and take down. It did excellent in high winds! Definitely recommend this product, buy it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Good tent.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for motorcycle camping and have used it on two trips so far. It packs a little bigger than I was hoping but that’s the trade off for a roomier tent. It goes up and tears down quick. Seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly everything that it says in the description was accurate! This is a perfectly lightweight tent that is compact and durable. I've used it three times now with no issues. Very easy to set up and unlike other tent bags, it is easily rolled up and fits snug in the tent bag!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use it this spring
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent, great quality easy set up with all the equipment including the foot print and a stake pusher. The storage bag is oversized making it simple to pack and add items to it as needed. Slightly heavier than I thought it would be but I'm extremely happy with it. Would recommend this product to anyone looking for a quality tent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Camped in rain three out of eight days. Stayed dry and had a ton of room. Pack the poles deprecate and the tent gets small. Also loved that I could assemble and pack up under the fly keeping things dry.
customer_reviews.author: joementum

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent mostly due to the weight and the price. I was recommended this brand by a friend and I must say it was worth the chance I took on it. I have taken it to the wilderness of all three Washington state National Parks, and it also survived a couple of the desert nation parks of Utah. Great product, good quality, I will consider this brand for other things in the future for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality so far
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent on a hunting trip at 10,000 feet elevation, didn’t rain, easy to set up and take down, worked great for one person and gear, might be a little small for two large adults
customer_reviews.author: Brett B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: We set this up in our yard to see how water proof it was and it did awesome with some pretty heavy rain BUT while we were taking it down the metal ring the poles go in to came off the tent.... If we can figure a way to replace the ring we will be set. Other wise its a great little tent and will work perfectly for what we need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Beats higher priced tents
customer_reviews.text: Great motorcycling tent. Comes with everything, fits in panniers and works great. After shopping for $400-$500 tents that don't even come with the footprint, Hyke and Byke make a lot of sense!
customer_reviews.author: Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Water collects on the inside of the Rain fly
customer_reviews.text: This tent is excellent in every way except water collects on the inside of the rain fly. Originally, I did not think this would be much of an issue but after using it for a week on a motorcycle trip and having to pack the rain fly away wet everyday. I cannot recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: michael minnich

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and a snap to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Had a very good night’s sleep at Angel Island in the SF Bay in February. Easy to set-up and very roomy for one. Just need to convince my wife it will fit both of us! Thanks Hyke and Byke, great product and philosophy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Tent
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I love the ease of assembly and the quality of the product. We camped one night (no rain) so far, so I can't comment on how durable it is long-term or how waterproof it is. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy 6.5 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Did not assemble due to the fact of the weight. 6.5 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Todd C

customer_reviews.title: Both were excellent on my Bikepacking trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought the sleeping bag and tent. Both were excellent on my Bikepacking trip. Only feedback... I'd prefer a closed roof tent so I can choose to avoid the rain fly. #packlight I live in AZ, so that's why. The doors provide great visible exposure to the outdoors. Pole system is awesome. Sets up in like 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K Jensen

customer_reviews.title: One man tent
customer_reviews.text: Really good tent. Light weight and withstands the rain well.
customer_reviews.author: CSM29403

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded every expectation
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my every expectation! I haven’t pitched a tent in 25yrs... had it set up in 5 min and the rain fly on And guyed out at 6 points in 15min with the included aluminum stakes. The tent stayed completely dry inside and was in heavy rain and even snow covered. I’ve told everyone I know about this tent and would recommend it to all. I’m 6’4” 250lbs and fit perfectly with room for companion and some gear inside and in the vestibules. Total satisfaction so far and will update after my Moto adventure next month.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY... Absolutely wonderful tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is by far one of the best I’ve ever bought. The polls almost connect them selves by themselves. Extremely well-made and comfortable. Absolutely love the reflecting stripes around it. 100% a great buy. Just took it out over the weekend and not only was I impressed but so was everybody else around me in the camp. Great job Hyke & Byke!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing easy to set good quality light weight. it fit in my 2015 Harley Davidson hard bag
customer_reviews.author: Keim bruser

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very good tent. It reflects well at night. Easy to assemble. Comfortable even at 32 degrees F
customer_reviews.author: jwright29

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Durable, Tent stakes are weak though.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE the tent, very easy to assemble and was awesome to have on my backpacking trip, only criticism is the tent stakes, they are pretty weak when it comes to desert ground, as I had one bend with mild to moderate pressure. But the tent itself I would recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Simba

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Tent
customer_reviews.text: I have only set this tent up indoors. I will be using it next year. I checked the stitching and seems which look fine.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Easy fast setup
customer_reviews.text: Took this thing camping two weekends straight just days after receiving it. Super fast shipping, and no issues upon receipt. After setting it up once before, the second time I was able to set up the tent in about 4 minutes. Love it
customer_reviews.author: jaymz

customer_reviews.title: Compact and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I have only been able to set this up indoors so far. We will be headed out camping next weekend. The tent was easy to assemble and has ample room for 2 people. Update: We took it out to Jackson Hole where it rained and snowed on us all weekend. We stayed completely dry. It fit my husband and I perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Coster

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Simple design, easy set up, light weight, two vestibules, and roomy. Cons: Color selection.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent so far
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this weekend with two days of steady rain. Not one leak. Its well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy K.

customer_reviews.title: Stupid easy to set up !!!
customer_reviews.text: This was super quick and easy to set up. Nice amount of room inside. Love that it has doors on each side.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight tent. Easy setup. In some of the documentation it says 2.5P and it's true. This thing is quite large. Big enough for 3 kids.
customer_reviews.author: Awksedgreep

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This tent surpassed our expectations. My husband and I along with a 150 dog and a 35 pound dog all slept comfortably in the tent. Assembly was very easy and we had it broken down and out away quickly. I have no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Fincannon

customer_reviews.title: Great tent with nice features.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tent. It's light and super easy to set up/tear down.
customer_reviews.author: MWent

customer_reviews.title: Quality Design + InTENTionality + Great Materials = Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! I love the quality and thought that went into this tent. For the record I put this tent up in less than 5 minutes... with a broken hand in a cast! That may not be impressive to everyone, but I think the simplicity and ease of setting the tent up is worth celebrating! Plenty of room for 2 people. Over all great product and love that I made the decision to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Went out for a little weekend fishing action with my gf, I’m 6’ 3” and we both had plenty of room. The double vestibule is nice too so you can have your gear on one side and still get out on the other. Nice and light weight, easy set up. Overall good quality
customer_reviews.author: austin walters

customer_reviews.title: Big, but compact!
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than I thought, but still compact. Without reading the instructions, my son and I were able to put the tent together in about 5 minutes. I love the unique single pole design with arms that hold the tent up. Now, the test in a couple of days as we backpack the Grouse Ridge area.
customer_reviews.author: Dan O.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Solid tent. Many great features. The tent stakes in particular.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Gould

customer_reviews.title: Stuff sack will only fit the tent only.
customer_reviews.text: Great backpacking tent for me and my 11 year old Boy Scout. He uses this as his main tent. Only recommendation would be to have a larger stuff sack. It's barely large enough for the tent itself, if you have the ground sheet or anything else in there it's like stuffing 10lbs of stuff in a 2lbs sack, just not going to happen. We ended up buying a GEERTOP adjustable tent compression bag for it that worked perfectly. I am eager to see what else this enterprising new gear maker has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: MCASE

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent for the price. Tent sets up quick and easy, includes foot print which is a must have at no additional cost!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size and keeping rain away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so that I could put my cot in there. I go out in the desert 4x4 and need a tent. My cot fits with room to spare. I like the vertical walls, Only negative was no instructions, I figured it out and easy set up. I wouldn't try in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy one
customer_reviews.text: Great tent sets up faster lightweight fit in a backpack !
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Really great tent for backpacking. Just used it in the Sierras for 5 days. Very easy setup, took less that 5 mins by myself. Very roomie and the double doors are great if you have two people in it. Well ventilated! Highly recommended this tent. 5 lbs total in weight. I used a couple small stuff sacks to split the tent up to get it in the pack easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: Living in Colorado, camping is huge. This tent is plenty big enough for 2 people and packs well. I’d pick this over a Marmot any day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that it’s portable and durable. Perfect for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Easy set up and very light. Excited to try it out. I also love that it comes with a footprint that you don’t have to buy seperately
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Stine

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift and it was just what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Took it out to Idaho for a week and it kept me warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: wayne pugh

product_meta.title: Hyke & Byke Zion 1 and 2 Person Backpacking Tents with Footprint - Lightweight Two Door Ultralight Dome Camping Tent
feature_bullets: LIFETIME WARRANTY - Hyke & Byke products have been tested and proved on countless epic adventures across the world by 60,000+ customers. If your product has a manufacturing defect simply let us know!

LIGHTWEIGHT and DURABLE - ultra light weight no-see-um mesh walls, accommodates a free standing ultralight set-up, comes with 12 7000 Series aluminum alloy stakes, reflective guy lines with tension lock cord adjustment, and a proprietary stake presser.
EASY TO SET UP - 1 pole with Clip-pole attachment for lighter weight, easier set up and better breath-ability. Perfect for 3 season backpacking trips.
FOOTPRINT and GEAR LOFT INCLUDED - PU 5000 footprint and mesh detachable ceiling loft pocket typically cost extra, but we've included them with your purchase.

WATERPROOF and EXTRA ROOMY - Near vertical walls maximize interior volume, PU 5000 rainfly, bathtub floor, and taped floor seams keeps rain out in stormy weather, two door, corner pockets, and two vestibule design for gear storage and easy access.
PACKS SMALL for BACKPACKING - Packs down small with included carrying sack so you can carry it easily on backpacking or camping trips.
